intro: Liparis sambiranoensis, commonly known as the Sambirano orchid, is a species of orchid native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
